question: What was Efua Dorkenoo famous for?
option1: A pioneer of the global movement to end the practice of apartheid
option2: A pioneer of the global movement to end the practice of child marriage
option3: A pioneer of the global movement to end the practice of polygamy
option4: A pioneer of the global movement to end the practice of female genital mutilation
answer: A pioneer of the global movement to end the practice of female genital mutilation
explanation: Efua Dorkenoo, affectionately known as "Mama Efua", was a Ghanaian-British campaigner against female genital mutilation (FGM) who pioneered the global movement to end the practice and worked internationally for more than 30 years to see the campaign "move from a problem lacking in recognition to a key issue for governments around the world."
